name: Robotics Controller Architecture Engineer
description:
We are looking for Robotics Controller Architecture Engineer to join The international company-system integrator for specialized robotic vehicles.

Relocation to China.

Duties:

  • Oversee daily work and schedules of technicians.
  • Assist with performance evaluations that are timely and constructive.
  • Collaborate with developers, fellow engineers, project managers, clients, and other stakeholders to understand the requirements and scope of the robotics project.
  • Ensure that robotic machines operate safely, dependably, and with precision; identify and implement modifications.
  • Contribute to system/subsystem architecture design of autonomy technologies, including vision systems, LiDAR, Radar, GPS, inertial systems, etc.
  • Develop, integrate, test and tune automated control devices, sensor modules and robotics components.
  • Design and develop robotic prototypes.
  • Design and implement tools for data collection such as data capture, data logging, data visualization, etc.
  • Work closely with hardware for the evaluation, data collection, and proof of concept of novel technologies.
  • Provide technical support and troubleshooting services for robotic systems.
  • Recommend, develop, and implement enhancements and improvements to increase production volume or precision in high-throughput operations.
  • Maintain knowledge of existing and developing technology and trends in robotics, apply them in practice.

Key Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in related field required; Master's degree preferred.
  • At least 3 years of proven working experience in the field of robotic systems.
  • Thorough understanding of electrical wiring and computer software engineering.
  • Extremely proficient with computer-aided drafting (SOLIDWORKS, CATIA, and other CAD software) software to create accurate drawings and schematics.
  • Program with strong Python and C/C++ implementation experience on real-time systems.
  • Experience with CAN, RS-232, RS-485 communication.
  • Experience with programmable logic controllers.
  • Excellent mathematical ability, strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to multi-task efficiently while still meeting deadlines.
  • Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Fluent both at oral and written English.

Terms and conditions

  • Competitive salary and attractive benefits;
  • Five-day week, 8 hours
  • Legalization in accordance with PRC labor legislation;
  • An excellent career opportunity with the High-Tech International company;
  • Opportunity for professional development;
  • Professional and friendly team;
  • International dynamic environment.
  • Salary and bonus levels are determined based on the results of the interview and probationary period.
